sentences: Kui sa oleksid mina, siis teeksid sedasi.
context: The word 'teeksid' is the conditional form of the Estonian verb 'tegema', which means 'to do' or 'to make'. It appears in conditional sentences, expressing what someone would do under certain circumstances. In the example sentence from the dictionary definition 'Mida sa teeksid kõige meelsamini?', it translates to 'What would you most willingly/preferably do?' This word is part of the conditional mood (konditsionaal) in Estonian, used for hypothetical situations or polite requests.
